alert.note: Alert for Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 11:14PM CDT until July 26 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR WEST CENTRAL ROANE COUNTY... At 1214 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area over the past few hours. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen since around 8 PM EDT. The rain has ended across the warning area however flooding is still possible as runoff continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that may still experience flash flooding include... Kingston, Rockwood and Midtown. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
